Client¶

The Client object is the base class from which all the requests are made, this is where you can get your games, authentify and get the models for your authenticated user.

class modio.client.Client(*, api_key=None, auth=None, lang='en', version='v1', test=False)[source]¶

Bases: object

Represents the base-level client to make requests to the mod.io API with. Upon initializiation the Client will confirm the api key and O Auth 2 token.

Parameters:
  • api_key (Optional[str]) – The api key that will be used to authenticate the bot while it makes most of its GET requests. This can be generated on the mod.io website. Optional if an access token is supplied.
  • auth (Optional[str]) – The O Auth 2 token that will be used to make more complex GET requests and to make POST requests. This can either be generated using the library’s oauth2 functions or through the mod.io website. This is referred as an access token in the rest of the documentation. If an access token is supplied it will be used for all requests.
  • lang (Optional[str]) – The mod.io API provides localization for a collection of languages. To specify responses from the API to be in a particular language, simply provide the lang parameter with an ISO 639 compliant language code. Default is US English.
  • test (Optional[bool]) – Whether or not to use the mod.io test environment. If not included will default to False.
  • version (Optional[str]) – An optional keyword argument to allow you to pick a specific version of the API to query, usually you shouldn’t need to change this. Default is the latest supported version.
rate_limit¶

Number of requests that can be made using the supplied API Key/access token.

Type:int
rate_remain¶

Number of requests remaining. Once this number hits 0 the requests will become rejected and the library will sleep until the limit resets then raise 429 TooManyRequests.

Type:int
rate_retry¶

Number of seconds until the rate limits are reset for this API Key/access token. Is 0 until the rate_remain is 0 and becomes 0 again once the rate limit is reset.

Type:int
BASE_PATH¶

str The base url for the api with the version and test/prod settings injected.

account_link(service, email)[source]¶

Link your mod.io account to one of the services. WIP

email_exchange(code)[source]¶

Exchanges the given 5-digit code for an OAuth2 token.

In the async version of this wrapper, this function is a coroutine.

Parameters:

code (int) – A 5-digit code received by email less than 15 minutes ago
Raises:
  • Unauthorized – Invalid security code
  • ValueError – Security code was not 5 digits long
Returns:

The access code. The access code will also be added directly to the Client’s access_token attribute.
Return type:

str
email_request(email)[source]¶

Posts an email request for an OAuth2 token. A code will be sent to the given email address which can then be entered into email_exchange().

In the async version of this wrapper, this function is a coroutine.

Parameters:email (str) – A valid email to which the 5-digit code will be sent
get_game(id: int)[source]¶

Queries the mod.io API for the given game ID and if found returns it as a Game instance. If not found raises NotFound.

In the async version of this wrapper, this function is a coroutine.

Parameters:id (int) – The ID of the game to query the API for
Raises:NotFound – A game with the supplied id was not found.
Returns:The game with the given ID
Return type:Game
get_games(*, filter=None)[source]¶

Gets all the games available on mod.io. Takes filtering arguments. Returns a named tuple with parameters results and pagination.

In the async version of this wrapper, this function is a coroutine.

Parameters:filter (Optional[Filter]) – A instance of Filter to be used for filtering, paginating and sorting results
Returns:The results and pagination tuple from this request
Return type:Returned
get_my_events(*, filter=None)[source]¶

Get events that have been fired specifically for the authenticated user. Takes filtering argmuments.

In the async version of this wrapper, this function is a coroutine.

Parameters:filter (Optional[Filter]) – A instance of Filter to be used for filtering, paginating and sorting results
Returns:The results and pagination tuple from this request
Return type:Returned
get_my_games(filter=None)[source]¶

Get all the games the authenticated user added or is a team member of. Takes filtering arguments.

In the async version of this wrapper, this function is a coroutine.

Parameters:filter (Optional[Filter]) – A instance of Filter to be used for filtering, paginating and sorting results
Raises:Forbidden – The access token is invalid/missing
Returns:The results and pagination tuple from this request
Return type:Returned
get_my_modfiles(*, filter=None)[source]¶

Get all the mods the authenticated user uploaded. The returned modfile objects cannot be edited or deleted and do not have a game_id attribute. Takes filtering arguments. Returns a named tuple with parameters results and pagination.

In the async version of this wrapper, this function is a coroutine.

Parameters:filter (Optional[Filter]) – A instance of Filter to be used for filtering, paginating and sorting results
Raises:Forbidden – The access token is invalid/missing
Returns:The results and pagination tuple from this request
Return type:Returned
get_my_mods(*, filter=None)[source]¶

Get all the mods the authenticated user added or is a team member of. Takes filtering arguments.

get_my_user()[source]¶

Gets the authenticated user’s details (aka the user who created the API key/access token)

In the async version of this wrapper, this function is a coroutine.

Raises:Forbidden – The access token is invalid/missing
Returns:The authenticated user
Return type:User

Raises:NotFound – A user with the supplied id was not found.

steam_auth(code)[source]¶

Request an access token on behalf of a Steam user. To use this functionality you must first have supplied your game’s secret encrypted app ticket key from Steamworks via the API in the ‘Options’ tab of your game profile.

In the async version of this wrapper, this function is a coroutine.

Parameters:code (str) – The Steam users Encrypted User Authentication Ticket. https://partner.steamgames.com/doc/features/auth#encryptedapptickets
Returns:The user’s access code
Return type:str
